titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2405) to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 1996 and 1997 for civilian science activities of the Federal Government, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-270, by Mr. Quillen.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2405 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. Upon adoption of this resolution, an amendment striking section 304(b)(3) of the bill shall be considered as having been adopted in the House and in the Committee of the Whole

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 99.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/29/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the open rule for the consideration of H.R. 2405 (Federal civilian science activities authorization).
